page.title: 04NATURAL HISTORY OF HOWNAM
page.content: Whether you are a resident or visitor the beauty of the area near Hownam so typical of the Scottish Borders,can't fail to impress you. The greys of the roofs and the marching stone walls,the pale greens of the fields highlighting the richer shades of the oak and ash, elderberry and sycamore,and the far darker conifers.The blooms of the wild rose,apple and rowen in May, and the shades of red of their fruits in the autumn.Flowers of all description grow beside the roads, from the tiny daisy and violet to the tall hedge parsley and fox glove.Yellows of dandelion and buttercup contrast with the blue-bell, thistle and campion, and the graceful rose-bay willow-herb sways in the wind adding to a jigsaw of colours. Birds too add their beauty,robin and sparrow chaffinch and blue-tit, rook and crow, go to make up a kaleidoscopic scene.
